name_origin.etymology: The name 'Basar Tzahov' is a Modern Hebrew descriptive calque (loan translation) of the traditional Judeo-Arabic classification. In North African cuisine, particularly Tunisian and Moroccan, stews (Mraka/Marqa) are strictly categorized by the color of their sauce: 'Hamra' (Red, using tomato and paprika) or 'Za'ara'/'Safra' (Yellow, using turmeric and saffron). While the provided name is Hebrew, the dish corresponds to the Tunisian 'Lham Asfar' (Yellow Meat) or 'Lham Za'ara'. The specific cooking technique described (roasting/searing a whole piece, slicing, then simmering in sauce) reflects the French colonial influence on Tunisian cuisine, specifically the 'Rôti', adapted to the Jewish palate with turmeric-based sauces.
name_origin.root_word: Hebrew: בָּשָׂר (Basar) + צָהוֹב (Tzahov) | Arabic equivalent root: S-F-R (Yellow)
name_origin.sources_notes: The Hebrew name is descriptive and likely adopted by immigrants to Israel to describe the traditional 'Mraka Za'ara' or 'Rôti' with turmeric sauce. In Tunisian dialect, 'Za'ara' implies a 'blonde' or yellow sauce free of tomato.

alternative_names.name: Lham Asfar
alternative_names.notes: Literal Arabic translation of Yellow Meat.

alternative_names.name: Mraka Za'ara
alternative_names.notes: Refers to the 'blonde' or yellow stew base used for the meat.

alternative_names.name: Rôti
alternative_names.notes: Tunisians (Jews and Muslims) often use this French term for pot-roasted beef, which is then sliced and served with sauce.

similar_dishes.name: Mqualli
similar_dishes.similarity: A meat tagine cooked in a yellow sauce (ginger, saffron, turmeric) without tomato.
similar_dishes.key_difference: Mqualli is usually braised raw-to-finish, whereas the described dish is roasted/baked then sliced and simmered.

similar_dishes.name: Tajine Zitoune (White/Yellow Version)
similar_dishes.similarity: Meat stew with olives in a turmeric/saffron sauce.
similar_dishes.key_difference: Focuses heavily on olives; the Jewish 'Basar Tzahov' focuses on the onion reduction and turmeric.

similar_dishes.name: Rôti de Veau Tunisien
similar_dishes.similarity: Roast veal or beef cooked with spices and sliced.
similar_dishes.key_difference: Often served with hard-boiled eggs (adma) or different garnishes; the Jewish version is distinct for its Shabbat-friendly preparation.
